title: The Inca
description: The archaeological record, Spanish sources, and ethnography of descendants provide distinct insights into Tawantinsuyu, the empire of the Incas. This course will visit key sites, monuments, and museum exhibitions relevant to the Inca empire and its expansion and continuity into the Spanish Colonial period. Lectures and readings on the archaeology, ethnohistory, and ethnography of South America will explore the origins and expansion of the Incas in conjunction with field trips and museum visits. Prerequisites: upper-division standing. Students must submit applications to the Global Initiatives Study Abroad Office and be accepted into the Global Seminars Program.
